taskDescription: Drag the concepts into the correct gaps

overallFeedback.feedback: You matched less than a quarter of the blanks correctly. Revise the glossary entries and try again.

resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
textField:
Black or white *A qualitative variable*
The troubling discovery that a number of published research findings cannot be replicated. *Replicability crisis*
Extent to which results vary over repeated sampling, or close replications. *Sampling variability*
A single value that is our best estimate of a population parameter. *Point estimate*
The concept that a variable has not effect. *Null hypothesis*
Group of individuals upon which no treatment is applied. *The control*
Measuring changes in body size along the elevation in a mountain. *Mensurative experiment*
A set of values, usually assumed large or infinite, about which we wish to draw conclusions. *Population*
What is measured in an experiment and it is expected to change *The dependent variable*
It can be measured. *A quantitative variable*
A set of data values chosen (often at random) from a population. *Sample*
The concept that a variable has a significant effect on a response. *Alternate hypothesis*
Measuring temperature in two temperature treatments with the same thermometer *Pseudo-replication*
Change in the response variable by an unintended variable. *Demonic intrusion*
Applying different treatments to different individuals. *Manipulative experiment*
a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
